boardgame.name: Jeepers! Creatures!
boardgame.description:
Jeepers! Creatures! is a game where 2-4 players take turns spinning to see if they match the bodies and arms of three creatures before everyone else to win the game.

Players spin and if the arrow points to one of their figures. If the spinner does not land on one of their creatures, they pass their turn. However, players that have the spinner land on their space are able to exchange multiple arms depending on if they can match the colored dots on the bottom of the figures and they can combo exchanges together.

The first player to match all three of their monsters with the correct arms wins the game.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave â€“ Gift Pack
boardgame.description:
Enhance any deck with a vast host of universal cards with 10 gambits, 10 upgrades and 12 objectives, you'll be spoiled for choice when constructing your decks.

A printed card dashboard, meanwhile, makes tracking your games simple – just place each of your decks and discard piles in the slots to check your cards at a glance. Use the dashboard to track activations and rounds, and spend less time trying to remember whose turn it is and more time working out deadly strategies! The set includes 3 round tokens for use with the above.

You'll need a copy of the Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave Core Set to use the contents of this pack.

listing.notes: New, never opened! Packaging has light storage wear.

boardgame.name: Lust from Beyond: M Edition
boardgame.description:
Do you dare to enter the dark world of Lusst'ghaa and face your deepest desires?

Play the new, more accessible cut of the fan-favorite survival horror Lust from Beyond.

Lust from Beyond: M Edition is a new version of the cult survival horror Lust from Beyond. This edition is tailored to the preferences of players who love the genre of Lovecraftian horror for its mystery, narrative, and atmosphere rather than explicit content.

We invite you to another world. A world fueled by desire, fascination, and fear. A world inspired by the disturbing works of H.P. Lovecraft, H.R. Giger, and Zdzislaw Beksinski.

You are Victor Holloway, an antiquarian tormented by visions of a sinister land, where there's no difference between pain and pleasure. To unravel the true meaning of your dreams, you join the esoteric Cult of Ecstasy.

Taste the cultist's life from within. Get lost in its blasphemous customs. Find out what happens when the pleasures of this world stop being enough.

Discover the gates to Lusst'ghaa, the mythical Land of Ecstasy, beyond the borders of reality or comprehension. Face what lurks there. Fight, hide, solve puzzles, find your answers... and survive.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Vendee 93
boardgame.description:
At the beginning of 1793, after the execution of King Louis XVI, France was drawn into a war against a coalition of most European monarchies. On 24 February, the National Convention decreed the mass draft of 300,000 men to defend the eastern borders.
Throughout the country, revolts broke out against this conscription, everywhere they were brutally repressed with success. However, an insurgent territory, called the "Vendée Militaire" resisted.
Determined to engage in a trial of strength with the new revolutionary regime, the Vendéens gradually organised themselves until they formed a "Catholic and Royal Army".
Vendée 93, a card driven game, takes you back to this particularly epic period in the french history, which pitted the young French Republic against the Royalist insurgents from March to October 1793.
"White" or "Blue", choose your cause and take command of your troops!
"White": you will have to take the advantage quickly at the risk of seeing the republican forces inexorably strengthen, forcing you into a sinister "Virée de Galerne".
"Blues": time is on your side, resist the first assaults of the "brigands" to then be able to face the hell of the bocage in order to definitively extinguish the insurrection.
Vendée 93 is a history game for one or two players with simple rules that can be played in two hours.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: High on Life
boardgame.description: Comedy

boardgame.name: Ara: History Untold
boardgame.description: Ara: History Untold delivers an evolution in turn-based historical grand strategy. Your choices will define the world you create, your experience, and your legacy.

boardgame.name: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
boardgame.description: Fantasy

boardgame.name: Lightyear Frontier
boardgame.description: Agriculture

boardgame.name: The Last Case of Benedict Fox
boardgame.description: Descend into a limbo of decaying memories as Benedict Fox, a self-proclaimed detective bound to his demon companion. Use that bond to explore the minds of the recently deceased in search for clues as you uncover the mysteries of an old mansion where a couple was murdered and their child has gone missing.

boardgame.name: Wild Life Mayan Be'et
boardgame.description:
You are one of the sons of Halach Uinic -the leader of the village-, who has inherited one of his father's lands. Now, you will try to manage the resources that the gods will give you in the dice you roll, with the objective of constructing buildings that will allow you to make the most outstanding and prosperous of all the Mayan cities by their imposing constructions, their spiritual influence, the priests established in your village, and the power of food production that your fields can generate.

In Mayan Be'et the initial player will roll 6 dice, take one, perform his actions considering 6 dice results, while the rest of the players at the same time will use the remaining 5 dice results to build imposing buildings, send to sacrifice, harvest or study their workers, exchange or reserve resources and send torrential rains to your rivals.

Each of these actions will earn you victory points, and the son whose village generates the most points will be Halach Uinic's favorite!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Pentiment
boardgame.description: Set in 16th century Bavaria, â€¯Pentimentâ€¯will take players on a narrative journey through the eyes of Journeyman Artist Andreas Maler during a time of great social unrest. Led by game director Josh Sawyer, this game is brought to life by a talented team inspired by illuminated manuscripts, woodcut prints, and history itself.

boardgame.name: Ereban: Shadow Legacy
boardgame.description: Ereban: Shadow Legacy, a fast-paced stealth platformer game where you become Ayana, the last descendant of a forgotten race. Harness mystical shadow powers, high-tech gadgets and avoid or kill to uncover the truth about your past and the key to saving a dying, morally grey universe.

boardgame.name: Ravenlok
boardgame.description: Ravenlok is an action-packed fairytale reimagining of a troubled kingdom and a young girl’s destiny to fulfill a dangerous prophecy.

boardgame.name: COCOON
boardgame.description: COCOON takes you on an adventure across worlds within worlds. Master world-leaping mechanics to unravel a cosmic mystery.

boardgame.name: "SHOTGUN!": The Road Trip Game
boardgame.description: Road trip boredom is about to become extinct: Introducing Shotgun!, our brand new family card game guaranteed to create the most memorable & hilarious drives of your life! Compete with your car mates by playing dares, trivia, challenges, questions, and more. With over 200 cards, you'll be entertained the whole trip -- and no two games are ever the same. So, fasten your seatbelts and hit the highway -- it's about time for a road trip! Don't forget to add Shotgun! to your packing list!

boardgame.name: Haphazard: Azulea Awakens
boardgame.description:
Navigate labyrinths, fight ferocious lurkers, discover loot, upgrade your character, and make a name for yourself... if you ever make it out.

Objective:

Haphazard is a unique narrative, campaign, dungeon crawler game. First, create a path on a grid, add some monsters and loot and locks… Next, compete with your rivals to exit the level first. The player with the most renown after playing all 11 unique levels wins.

Gameplay can be divided into 3 main phases


Create your labyrinth for your rival to solve
Explore- move, collect gold, fight lurkers, pick locks
Upgrade- buy items, heal up, prepare for the next level


Just because you exit a level first doesn't mean you have the most renown. Your character's FLAIR and number of HP (health) remaining will also impact renown.

Each time you begin a level, you will listen to a dramatized story. When you fight certain monsters or encounter certain locks, the player sheet will instruct you to listen to another entry in the story.

The Story Unfolds:

You’ve never left the shadow of the volcano on which you and your small town of Azulea have called home for as long as anyone can remember.

Visitors are always wary of the volcano, and when it blasts little puffs of smoke, they quickly grab their bags and leave, asking why you stay despite the danger.

Your answer is always the same.

“Respect. We treat her with respect and she reciprocates.”

One day, your peaceful world suddenly shattered.

A mysterious fox arrived and your town welcomed him. He was given the best food, and a room at your cousin’s bed and breakfast. In the morning, he was gone, but your cousin brings you a note he had left on his bed.

"Azulea awakes. She is angry. Find a new home.
Don’t follow me. Eight travelers tried. Eight travelers died."

And so you embark on a journey to take back a precious stone and return it to Azulea before your entire village is destroyed.

Three modes:

Head to head (create a labyrinth for each other)
Solo (paper with required web application)
3-5 players (plus one Dungeon Master)

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tokyo Sidekick: Special Event Scenario â€“ Akihabara Web
boardgame.description:
Delve into a new story unfolding in Tokyo!

Experience a frightening new story for Tokyo Sidekick! People are disappearing from Akihabara's idol music scene, and Hi-Q and Haruki want to know why. Join your favorite characters - and a few new ones - as they face a challenge that will really test your teamwork! Can you stop this new Menace in time?

boardgame.name: Pewt 'em Up!
boardgame.description:
Pewt 'em Up! is a free to play, retro inspired arcade space shoot 'em up. The game features a Stage Mode in which you follow the story of Cadet Claire Voyage, a roguelite Endless Mode, lots of upgrades, achievements, extras like gallery, music player and more. There are no ads, no in-app purchases and you can play offline.

ABOUT & CONTACT
Programming by Kitadashi, Graphics by Niamara.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Idrottsbragder
boardgame.description:
The quiz for those who love sports. Questions about the biggest swedish and international sports events,
accomplishments now and then, athletes, records and moments to remember from the world of sports.

Contains 60 questions and a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.

boardgame.name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: StÃ¥ upp! Vi Ã¤r gul och blÃ¥!
boardgame.description:
A quiz game about the swedish national football team.
Contains 60 questions and a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.

boardgame.name: What's The Deal?
boardgame.description:
A deck-builder that has players competing to build influence by collecting Prospects base upon famous personalities from around the world.

2-5 players draw resources of Energy, Skills and Confidence that they use to pay for Prospects ranging from politicians to tech innovators to washed up celebrities. These Prospects have bonus abilities that can turn the tide of the game. Collecting Prospects gains Influence Points. When the Draw Deck is depleted, the player with the most influence wins.

But watch out for the Meetings! When a meeting card is drawn, the game play pauses and the players vote using their resources to turn the game on its head.

boardgame.name: Tempest 4000
boardgame.description:
Tempest 4000 is a shoot 'em up video game. Players take a control of the Claw, a spacecraft that can shoot at enemies and obstructions. Levels take place on geometric prisms. The goal of the game is to survive each level by eliminating enemies as soon as possible and to achieve high scores for leaderboard positions. The game features one hundred levels and three game modes: standard, pure, and endurance.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tempest_4000 Tempest 4000]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: The Game of Quizzer
boardgame.description:
The Game of Quizzer is a questionnaire game from Stoll & Edwards, basically a precursor to such titles as Trivial Pursuit. Players use a spinner to randomly select a question from an included book that pertains to geography, history, government, science, or "every day facts of interest." The game book is advertised as including "Over 1,000 Questions and Answers."

The game also includes a box of colored chits, called "Pawns," that are used to cover spaces on a tile and thus show a player's progress toward winning.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Cosmic Clash Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Marvel's First Family the Fantastic Four and their greatest foes face off! In Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Cosmic Clash, you and up to 3 friends can battle it out on the tabletop with tactics, teamwork, science, and sorcery!

This brand-new starter set features Mr. Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch, The Thing, Silver Surfer, and Dr. Doom, each with incredible poses and multiple points lines to play with for maximum flexibility when building teams! Team up the Fantastic Four against Dr. Doom, play 4-player games with Mr. Fantastic and Invisible Woman vs. Human Torch and The Thing vs. Silver Surfer and Dr. Doom, or play any other combination you like!

Additionally, this starter set comes with special scenario and campaign gameplay to explore, dice with the Fantastic Four logo that you would normally only find in a Dice & Token Pack, and 4 full-color maps featuring iconic Fantastic Four settings like Mr. Fantastic's Lab and Doom's Castle with location gameplay abilities!

This boxed-set is a great way for 1 to 4 players to learn HeroClix! Play with the contents of this starter set or combine it with other HeroClix figures for even more fun!
This starter set contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix (Exact game components subject to change): - 6 HeroClix Figures - 6 HeroClix Character Cards - 18 Object and Terrain Tokens - 4 Full-Color Maps - 2 Six-Sided dice with the Fantastic Four logo - 1 HeroClix Powers & Abilities Card - 1 HeroClix Core Rulebook - 1 Scenario/Campaign Rulebook

boardgame.name: Clackerjack
boardgame.description:
Clackerjack is a climbing game that is played with two sets of double-six dominoes. It can be played by four players, in fixed partnerships, or by two players, in a head-to-head duel.

The blank tiles, which are all wilds, get distributed equitably between the two sides; each player then draws their own hand of tiles from the boneyard. The goal is to ditch all of these dominoes through the skillful play of combinations and bombs.

Lots of bombs.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Bayonetta & Vanquish 10th Anniversary Bundle
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Bundle containing Bayonetta and Vanquish on a single Disc.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American XBOX One Launch edition

boardgame.name: Sword & Scoundrel - Contents & Consent
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sword & Scoundrel is a game that easily lends itself to mature themes and complicated subject matter. It is designed to emulate a kind of story-telling where moral gray areas are the norm and pushing characters to their limits can take you to dark places. This is natural and expected. Role-playing can be a great and healthy way to explore and experience topics that you would never want to deal with in real life. However, such content needs to be handled with care. While playing a character in a fictional setting may give you an extra sense of security and emotional distance, for some players and for some topics, it might not be enough.

boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 34
December 2002

Knights of the Dinner Table
An Interview with Tim Bradstreet
D20 Modern: The New Age of Roleplaying

The Night of Walking Shadows

boardgame.name: Picture Building Game
boardgame.description:
Picture Building Game is a simple, self-explanatory game for small children, to "unconsciously learn to distinguish between the different colors, also the simple numerals" (according to the ad copy).

Four different colored 7" x 9" cards are included, each with a 3x3 grid of spaces numbered 1-9. One card goes to each player. Four color pictures of children at play, cut into rectangular pieces, are also in the box. Each disassembled piece has a colored number on the back assigning it to a specific square on a specific card.

The object of the game is to use the included "indicator" spinner) and compile a complete picture on your card.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Bigger Island
boardgame.description:
Double-sided combat map with tropical sandy islands on one side connected with stone fords, and rocky islands with bridged on the other.

27" by 39", 45% bigger than standard Pathfinder Flip-Mats.

boardgame.name: Enormous Forest
boardgame.description:
Double-sided combat map sprawling sections of forest. Dense and primeval on one side, a shaded road on the other.

30" x 46" unfolded. Wet erase, dry erase, and permanent marker ink can be erased.

boardgame.name: Enormous Basic
boardgame.description:
Double-sided combat map with light gray or light brown backgrounds with grids, to draw any encounter on, similar to the Basic and Bigger basic flip-mats.

30" x 46" unfolded. Wet erase, dry erase, and permanent marker ink can be erased.

boardgame.name: ÐœÐµÐ½ÐµÑÑ‚Ñ€ÐµÐ»Ð¸ (Minstrels)
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the tournament of the best voices of fairy kingdoms! Here you will become minstrels composing songs about precedented and unprecedented feats of heroes — be it noble robbers, wise wizards, greedy dragons, valiant knights or beautiful princesses!

ÐœÐµÐ½ÐµÑÑ‚Ñ€ÐµÐ»Ð¸ (Minstrels) is a roll-and-place game. Each player receives his own game board, on which he will place wooden figures of heroes and combine them. Gameplay is fast and simple: each round 2 dice are rolled and two numbers are shown, which simultaneously corresponds a place on game board where a figure of hero can be placed, and the type of a figure. Starting with the first player, all players take turns and choose individually for himself which one die will indicate the place on game board, and which die will indicate the figure of hero. In addition, a player can change numbers on dices individually for himself by paying coins.

Adapt to rolled result or change it with coins and collect the most profitable combinations, because correct arrangement of heroes in rows, columns, and cells corresponding to the quest card will bring you victory points! Player who gain most points will be winner and earn the title of the most talented minstrel who sang the best song!

boardgame.name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: War Box Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for The Quacks of Quedlinburg with both expansions - The Alchemists and The Herb Witches along with plastic tokens fitting in base game box.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Alchemists
The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches

boardgame.name: Mystery Party in the Box: Solsticio Oscuro
boardgame.description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

Once every ten years, vampires gather in a northern town during the winter solstice for their Great Gathering. Shortly before the official start, however, a charred corpse is discovered nearby: it can only be the remains of the second-in-command of one of the two contending factions of vampire society.

boardgame.name: Mystery Party in the Box: El cuento de los lobos Crepusculares
boardgame.description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

The peaceful daily life of a remote village, in which legends about the existence of werewolves still survive, is disrupted when the body of a traveling merchant is discovered the day after the great celebration that has taken place in the town. The victim has been severely beaten, having had entire strands of hair pulled out and shows deep tears to his neck, just as one would expect from a werewolf attack. As if this wasn't alarming enough, two months ago the blacksmith's wife was murdered under identical circumstances.

boardgame.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game â€“ War Box Insert
boardgame.description:
A wooden game organizer for Legendary Encounters series: Alien/Predator/Firefly/X-Files deck building game. It accommodates sleeved cards and leaves quite a lot of space for future expansions - it is shown in our pictures. Additionally you receive 23 adjustable dividers which can help you in card selection.

The insert is made from a wooden and light plywood. The plywood is bright what makes it possible to paint or varnish. We suggest using Wikol glue in order to strengthen the effects of putting the inserts' parts together.

boardgame.name: Mystery Party in the Box: La bruja que se fue con el crepÃºsculo
boardgame.description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

The girls' college that adjoins the high school grounds closed its doors seven years ago, but left in its wake the legend of a mysterious witch who disappeared from the chapel along with the beautiful tolling of the bell that rang from the top of the building.

boardgame.name: Pantalla de Los Mitos de Cthulhu de Sandy Petersen
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Algunas cosas es mejor mantenerlas ocultas...

La pantalla de Los Mitos de Cthulhu de Sandy Petersen contiene las tablas, reglas y referencias más importantes para poder dirigir una partida terrorífica con la quinta edición del más famoso de los juegos de rol de fantasía clásica. Tablas de encuentros, locuras aleatorias, y reglas de estados están al alcance de tu mano, dándote más tiempo para dirigir la partida, y menos para buscar en el libro de reglas. Y, por el lado de los jugadores, una impresionante ilustración para ambientar tus partidas de los Mitos.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Pantalla de Los Mitos de Cthulhu de Sandy Petersen

boardgame.name: Abuelito Serpiente Yig
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Desde el apogeo de su imperio durante el Triásico, los hombres serpiente han sido unos meticulosos planificadores y unos intrigantes taimados. Estas criaturas con cabeza de serpiente parecen humanoides y a menudo cambian de forma mediante la magia para parecer humanoides. Sin embargo, tienen la mente tan fría como la sangre. Si bien ya no gobiernan vastas extensiones del mundo, hay quien dice que su imperio y sus insidias se han extendido aún más. Los astutos hombres serpiente acechan en el corazón de cada reino, acaparando poder y esperando el momento oportuno para ejecutar su plan maestro.

En Abuelito Serpiente Yig también aparecen de manera destacada los hombres serpiente y el anhelo de estos por los viejos tiempos, que amenaza al mundo moderno. Pero, a la vez, sus propios planes se ven alterados cuando otros seres antiguos desplazados aparecen en el presente por accidente.

¿Supondrá la aparición de estos súperseres el fin para la humanidad y las razas con las que está aliada?

Esta aventura hace constantes referencias a Los Mitos de Cthulhu de Sandy Petersen para la 5.ª edición, por lo que tener un ejemplar de ese libro es imprescindible para dirigirla.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Rebellion â€“ e-Raptor Insert
boardgame.description:
e-Raptor Insert compatible with Star Wars: Rebellion is your must have accessory designed to organize and improve the experience of the gameplay.

Thanks to our insert you can arrange all game components and sleeved cards to keep them in order – no more mess on the table while playing. No more looking for necessary elements during the game.

Moreover, when the box is closed, the components are still kept in order, ready for setting another game faster than ever!

The insert is durable and made of high-quality HDF. To assemble it, there is no glue required. It allows you to hold all components inside the box

boardgame.name: 246 Corbitt Street
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

«Alerta 246: tiroteo en una zona residencial de la ciudad». El aviso suena en vuestras radios. Parece que todo ha sucedido en el interior de una misteriosa mansión situada en Corbitt Street. Vosotros, miembros del cuerpo de policía, sois los encargados de investigar el caso y os adentráis en la casa para un primer reconocimiento. Pero pronto descubriréis que las piezas no acaban de encajar, y lo que empezó como una noche de servicio rutinaria desembocará en algo inesperado y terrorífico.

Una aventura que constituye un homenaje a todo un clásico como es «La mansión Corbitt», el escenario de La llamada de Cthulhu con el que más jugadores se han introducido en este juego.

246 Corbitt Street es una aventura de investigación con un trasfondo de los Mitos, pensada para 4 o 5 jugadores.

Está diseñada para que sean las acciones de los jugadores las que vayan determinando el desarrollo de los sucesos. Sin embargo, también se puede dirigir de forma más lineal, conduciendo a los investigadores, paso a paso, hasta la escena final.

Como Guardián, tú decides. 246 es el código que la policía estadounidense usa para alertar de un posible tiroteo, y con un aviso de este tipo es precisamente como se inicia esta aventura. En ella, los investigadores son hombres y mujeres del departamento de policía de la ciudad, que deberán dilucidar qué ha ocurrido en una casa suburbial que tiene fama de encantada. Los personajes desconocen totalmente los Mitos, por lo que 246 puede ser un escenario ideal para introducirse en la materia.

La acción de 246 Corbitt Street se sitúa en 2019, aunque puedes llevarla a la época que más te guste sin demasiada dificultad —tendrás que cambiar, eso sí, las cómodas búsquedas en internet por tediosas y encantadoras horas de biblioteca—. También puedes ambientarla en la ciudad que prefieras.

La historia se basa en lo ocurrido justo antes de que los personajes de los jugadores entren en escena, y por ello se da una descripción exhaustiva de los hechos previos. Aun así, puede haber multitud de elementos que no estén especificados. Siéntete libre de inventar e improvisar todo aquello que no esté escrito aquí como parte del caso.

Por último, debes saber que 246 Corbitt Street constituye un homenaje a «La casa Corbitt», el más clásico de los escenarios de La Llamada de Cthulhu de JOC Internacional. Sin duda, con algo de trabajo puedes modificar esta historia para que suponga una continuación de aquella, aunque funciona igual como historia independiente.

boardgame.name: El siniestro pueblo de Karpino
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Un cadáver de rasgos humanoides ha sido encontrado a las afueras de una pequeña aldea de Rumanía. El cuerpo tiene colmillos pronunciados, orejas puntiagudas y sus órganos internos no están dispuestos como los de los humanos. Entre los expertos que se están dirigiendo a Rumanía para estudiar el cadáver estáis vosotros.

boardgame.name: La bestia no debe nacer
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

La bestia no debe nacer es una campaña mítica escrita por Ricard Ibáñez con el sistema de juego de La Llamada de Cthulhu 7ª ed.

Unos combatientes norteamericanos de la Primera Guerra Mundial se despiertan en un hospital militar de París. Todos sufren amnesia parcial y llevan tatuado un extraño signo en el hombro derecho. Un misterio que marcará sus vidas para siempre y que los llevará a recorrer medio mundo en busca de respuestas que acallen sus pesadillas.

Esta nueva edición de la mítica campaña escrita por Ricard Ibáñez cuenta con una aventura inédita, En tierra extraña, escrita treinta y un años después de la original de 1989. En esta aventura, un grupo de soldados que luchan en las trincheras del frente francés tendrán que adentrarse en territorio enemigo para acabar con unos horrores que pondrán a prueba su cordura.

Revive los misterios de La bestia no debe nacer con un diseño actualizado, nuevas ilustraciones y mapas isométricos y cenitales.

boardgame.name: Un llanto desesperado
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Un llanto desesperado es una aventura pensada para cuatro jugadores, diseñada para el sistema de juego La llamada de Cthulhu. Por los temas tratados —violencia, cáncer, suicidio—, se recomienda su lectura solo a jugadores maduros.

Esta es una historia basada en los Mitos pero difícilmente se la puede considerar una aventura lovecraftiana como tal. El horror cósmico está presente, y quizá al final se desate sobre toda la población, pero no es la semilla a partir de la que ha germinado esta historia. Esta aventura pretende llevar los Mitos de Cthulhu a los límites de lo moral y poner a prueba las convicciones de los personajes… ¿qué ocurre cuando se puede salvar a un ser querido a costa de la vida de otros?, ¿toda sangre derramada vale lo mismo?, ¿o quizá hay vidas que no merecen ser vividas y otras que sí? ¿Qué ocurre cuando el villano hace cosas buenas usando medios horribles?, ¿acaso el fin justifica los medios?… Un llanto desesperado obliga a los personajes a enfrentarse a estas preguntas. Y lo hace mediante una aventura de investigación que, inspirada en series como True Detective, los conducirá, prueba tras prueba, a la verdad que se oculta en los pantanos del sur de Luisiana.

Suerte contestándolas.

boardgame.name: La reputaciÃ³n del seÃ±or CastiÃ±eira
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

En el verano de 1986, una familia adinerada contrata, de forma extraoficial, a un grupo de ex-policías para esclarecer el origen de unas amenazas que pueden acabar con la reputación familiar. Una investigación en un Madrid convulso. Una ciudad que mostrará su verdadera cara, oscura, plagada de drogas, delincuencia y prostitución, en la que nada es lo que parece y que llevará a los protagonistas a un decadente descenso a la locura.

LA REPUTACIÓN DEL SEÑOR CASTIÑEIRA es una aventura larga para La Llamada de Cthulhu 7ª edición ambientada en la España de los años 80. Incluye tres personajes pregenerados.

Basado en la novela La trama de la telaraña, de J. D. Lisbona, publicada por ediciones Pàmies.

boardgame.name: El cantante de Dhol
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

«El Cantante de Dhol» es un escenario para La llamada de Cthulhu 7º edición en los años 20, localizado en la isla de Oyster, Maine.
Está diseñada para jugarse en una única sesión para un grupo de 4 a 5 jugadores y, al utilizarse personajes pregenerados. Sería recomendable que los Guardianes intentaran familiarizarse con su complejo trasfondo.
No se requiere conocimientos de los Mitos, pero sí de un grupo de jugadores experimentados y/o con talento. El escenario está inspirado en el cuento de M. R. James «Silba y acudiré».

boardgame.name: Hidden Corp (vol. 1)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Hidden Corp. consta de cuatro aventuras distribuidas en dos libros o módulos, cada uno de los cuales tiene dos de ellas. Este es el primero de ellos. El mundo en el que transcurre es algo «alternativo», puesto que en él se pueden entremezclar personajes históricos con algunos de ficción literaria o cinematográfica.

La idea general no es que sea muy original, lo sabemos, porque si coges cualquier libro o cómic de los llamados pulp te encuentras esta clase de historias en la mayoría de sus páginas. Solo hay que pensar en las típicas de Edgard Rice Burroughs protagonizadas por el personaje de aventuras John Carter, o incluso En el corazón de la tierra, La tierra olvidada por el tiempo y La gente del tiempo perdido, en las de H. G. Wells —La guerra de los mundos, por ejemplo— o en las del propio H. P. Lovecraft —Mitos de Cthulhu, entre otras—. Y, si nos apuras, también habría que mencionar las penny dreadfuls, publicaciones seriadas populares y baratas escritas durante el siglo XIX en el Reino Unido.

Aparte, existen películas y series de televisión con temas similares, como la serie de películas de Indiana Jones o la trilogía de La Momia, las divertidas versiones de las novelas de Burroughs, protagonizadas por el actor Doug McClure, o la serie Penny Dreadfuls.

Dejando a un lado el tema de la originalidad, el autor ha creado las partidas y, como hemos dicho antes, poco después las moldeó con las normas del sistema de juego de Pulp Cthulhu, tomándose incluso la licencia de que en un principio los héroes pertenecían a la sede del Club Vanguardia, situada en Arkham, Massachusetts. Las idó con la mezcla explosiva que tiene cada módulo o aventura: el ya conocido horror cósmico, misteriosas organizaciones secretas, acción en la búsqueda de objetos bíblicos o históricos y, cómo no, los nazis.

Así pues, si lo que estás buscando es lo que os acabamos de explicar, no lo pienses más: con este libro lo vas a pasar bien, tanto si arbitras como si juegas.
Esta campaña está pensada para jugarla como si de una película o libro típico de aventuras o acción se tratara. Si te gustaron las películas o libros que antes hemos mencionado, así como las de aventuras de los años treinta, cuarenta y cincuenta del siglo pasado, como El secreto de los incas o Las minas del rey Salomón, o las novelas El mundo perdido, de Arthur Conan Doyle, La máquina del tiempo, de H. G. Wells o algunas de Julio Verne, esta es tu partida y este es tu juego. Pulp Cthulhu tiene todo eso y mucho más.

Y sin ser exactamente como ellas, esta campaña combina a la perfección esa atmósfera de aventura, acción, misterio, horror y terror, para hacer que tanto el jugador como tú, futuro Guardián, disfrutéis a lo grande.

boardgame.name: Los cinco escalones
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Los cinco escalones es un escenario victoriano de investigación para La Llamada de Cthulhu 7ª edición.

La trama comienza con una muerte extraña, pero sin ningún componente necesariamente sobrenatural y así irá transcurriendo mientras descubren que no todo es lo que parece.

Esta historia se plantea con un marcado carácter “teatral”. Esto quiere decir que en algunas ocasiones primará la forma sobre el fondo, y que algunos eventos ocurrirán exactamente cuando tengan valor dramático.

Todo esto busca una experiencia de juego concreta y apoyar un tono particular que pretendemos que Los cinco escalones sugiera y transmita a los jugadores. El autor está convencido, y las pruebas de juego así lo apuntan, que la experiencia de juego primará sobre los pequeños detalles, y el grupo sabrá disculpar las casualidades forzadas, a cambio de las cuales se llevará escenas intensas y heroicas.

boardgame.name: 50 Special Dungeon Rooms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a dungeon, no matter how deep you go, surprises still await...

Add some spice to your adventure with these 50 Special Dungeon Rooms full of trials and treasures! Each room comes with a name, a description, and related tables (when it applies).

boardgame.name: Lake of Stone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A shallow lake has been discovered to have what must be hundreds of incredibly realistic human statues, broken into many pieces, strewn across the lakebed. From the tale of the witness, it is believed the lake is the fabled Dil-Pais shun Ellok, meaning the ‘ever-waters’, or what the locals call the Lake of Stone. Its purple waters were said to make one’s body more youthful, extending their life. Although seeming a fantastic find, what lies beneath the surface could lead to the demise of the unwary.

Lake of Stone is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 10th-level characters and higher. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: A Man's Word
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not everything is always as it appears, and nothing could be more accurate when stumbling upon this bloody scene. A lone survivor, his life slowly leaking out, asks for aid hesitantly when the party arrives. But looking around, the truth seems not to be within the words shared about the deadly confrontation. To discover what really happened will take some detective work to piece the clues together.

A Man’s Word is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 3rd-level characters and higher. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Broken Tigers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a city of memories is a city of violence.

Traditional wisdom says one cannot go back to one’s home, because one cannot travel in memory. To forget one’s past is to forget one’s self, but the past is always a trap for the present. Of course, you’ve never been one to let good advice ruin a bad plan. An old friend is in trouble, and no matter what trap the past has laid, you’ll help them if you can—and you are certain that you can.

Broken Tigers is a 45-page PDF adventure for Sword Noir: A Role-Playing Game of Hardboiled Sword & Sorcery (Second Edition) with 6 pre-generated characters for use by the players. While the adventure does not require the use of Sword Noir, the narrative characters and some situations are based on that system and would require modification to use with another.

boardgame.name: The Demon Tower of Valdig Fel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Demon Tower of Valdig Fel is the first adventure specifically set in the Isle of Eldisor Hexcrawl Campaign Setting. Designed for use with Labyrinth Lord, it is easily adapted to any OSR-Style Role-Playing Game.

The Demon Tower of Valdig Fel is an ancient, much-storied flying citadel in the shape of a demon’s head. Since the death of its creator during the Wars of Succession following the Fall of Eldisor, it has passed through the hands of countless villains, who have used the flying tower to raid, pillage, and enslave the peoples of the Ivory Plains and beyond. Terrible tales of wizards, demons, and dragons follow in its wake.

And now it has drifted into a tree-lined ridge near Wulf’s Ferry… right in your own backyard!

What are the inhabitants up to? Are they here to raid or to trade?

What of the rumors of centuries of treasure hidden within?

Are you brave or foolish enough to find out?

The Demon Tower of Valdig Fel is designed for use with Labyrinth Lord and other OSR-Style Role-Playing Games. Designed for use for a party of 4 to 6 adventurers of 5th to 7th level, its dangers can easily be increased or decreased for more powerful or less experienced parties.

boardgame.name: Lady Adoncia Carvendona "The Baroness"
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lady Adoncia Carvendona, The Baroness, wears many masks: gracious noblewoman; patroness of the arts and humanities; saboteur; radical mastermind; supervillain. From her base in Vadashar, she sits at the center of a vast criminal and smuggling empire. A true zealot, Adoncia borders on the megalomanical, believing her efforts to create a better world immunize her against the consequences of her schemes. Ultimately, she sees herself as a god creating chaos for the sake of birthing a better world (one created in her image).

Included:

A brief history of the Free City of Vadashar
Deep backstory and character descriptions for Lady Adonica and her most powerful minions
Information about her international organization hierarchy
Faction goals, desires, and methods
Introduction to a new cult
Adventure hooks
New magic items
NPC stat blocks
Advice for incorporating a supervillain like Lady Adoncia into your campaign

boardgame.name: Primal Forest (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of glossing over the details of your characters’ overland journey (except for the inevitable, violent random encounters)? Want to add minor features of interest to their journeys? Want to make their journeys seem more “real”?

Then Wilderness Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different type of wilderness and gives you--the busy GM--the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features, events and encounters. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, it is an invaluable addition to your GM's toolbox!

Wilderness Dressing: Primal Forest presents:

Minor Events: One table (100 entries) presenting minor events to enliven your characters’ wilderness travel.
Minor Dressings: One table (100 entries) presenting interesting minor terrain features of note.
Uneventful Day's Travel: One table (20 entries) presenting descriptions of uneventful days on the road.
Campsites: One table (20 entries) presenting campsites to add details to your characters' overnight wilderness trips.
Random Encounters: One table (12 entries) presenting ready to use random encounters.

boardgame.name: Owlbear's Nest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the owlbear nests in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Mining Town Dressing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the mining towns in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Polymorph: The Martial Master (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this book you will get a full 1-20 class that is conceptually a hybrid class of the monk, barbarian and swashbuckler classes from Pathfinder 1st Edition. While you will see elements of each of the "parent" classes, they are introduced in a fresh way that brings a new way to approach martial combat. In addition to the base class you will get 6 sub-classes (called focus techniques) to provide some tweaks on how the class is handled. All-in-all the martial master will provide an excellent class for those players seeking a new, more measured and interesting martial class or for GMs to provide a challenging combatant.

boardgame.name: Rainbow Go!
boardgame.description:
Compete over ten rounds to claim victory in this fast paced trivia game.

One player hosts the game and everyone else battles it out. Each question has seven clues but only one right answer. The clues get easier, but the less you use, the more points you win! Any player can answer every question, so it's a race to react and slap the "go" card first.

How will you play? Go! for a high score, guess early, and risk crashing out of the round? Or Go! steady, use more clues and cunningly capture more points?

After the ten rounds whoever has the most points wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Foundations of Rome: Deluxe First-Player Marker
boardgame.description: A small bronze statue miniature to indicate first player and replace the in-package first player marker.

boardgame.name: Moral Conflict: Family Edition
boardgame.description:
Find out who’s the goody-two-shoes and whose antics are deserving of a time out in this hilarious game of “most likely to”! Each card lists a different scenario, anything from “who’s most likely to accidentally drop something in the toilet?” to “who’s most likely to claim to have been abducted by aliens?”.

Players take turns to read out the cards and nominate a player using their whiteboard paddles. The player with the least nominations at the end of the game is the winner and can claim their title as the most well-behaved of the bunch!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: O Homem que Mordeu a Caderneta de Cromos
boardgame.description:
The game is based on telling strange and bizarre stories, based on the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To whom?”, “With what? " it's because?".

In "O Homem Que Mordeu a Caderneta de Cromos", players set out in search of bizarre stories to tell when they land in the right house, and try to make their listeners laugh, so that they can earn prestigious coins. The possibilities are endless! Put creativity to the test and tell the best story!

The game takes place with the roll of a dice that moves us forward on the board. Through the house where we fall, we exchange our cards for others of the same color, changing the title of our bizarre news.
When we hit the "Está na Hora" house, we started to invent our story based on the title we were building in front of us.
We have time counted by an hourglass and if we get away with it within that time and we manage to convince the other players, we win a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game the player with the most prestigious coins wins.

It is the same game as "O Homem que Mordeu o Cão" but with a 70's/80's theme.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: O Homem Que Mordeu o CÃ£o
O Homem Que Mordeu o CÃ£o

boardgame.name: Cthulhu D100
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Por primera vez puedes adquirir el manual Cthulhu D100 en físico. Una edición en tapa dura que incluye el reglamento y la aventura Carne quemada, sobre un grupo de investigadores que emiten el pódcast Charlas desde las sombras, centrado en documentar sucesos sin resolver y en revisitar antiguas noticias que quedaron en el olvido para esclarecer la insólita verdad que se oculta tras ellas. En esta ocasión investigarán el misterioso incendio del hospital St. Clarence’s para veteranos de guerra, un caso que las autoridades cerraron con rapidez y del que no quedan testigos ni supervivientes.

boardgame.name: Wamatse
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

¿QUÉ ES WAMATSE?

Wamatse es una aventura de terror e investigación para adultos, diseñada para cuatro jugadores y un director de juego, que utiliza como motor de juego el sistema Cthulhu d100. La trama toma como punto de partida un macabro suicidio que ocurrirá dentro de pocos años en un hipotético Madrid futuro. A partir de ese instante, los personajes, pregenerados y diseñados para potenciar la experiencia de juego, se verán arrastrados por una espiral de violencia, psicología rota y esoterismo que les costará la vida o la cordura.

¿ESTÁS PREPARADO PARA LLEVAR AL LÍMITE TU SENSIBILIDAD?

Ve tras los pasos de un asesino en serie sádico y macabro y pon a prueba tus habilidades en esta aventura moralmente sofocante, de violencia extrema y locura sobrenatural.

Y TÚ, ¿QUÉ PAPEL JUGARÁS EN LA CAZA DEL ASESINO?


Alejandro Martínez: expolicía de la interpol dado a la bebida.
Rafael Trento: sacerdote con un pasado devastador.
Nayara García: prodigio de la programación famosa en la deep web.
Rubén Gutierrez: luchador de artes marciales mixtas curtido en las calles.

boardgame.name: Kandaria
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new volume of the official Atlas of Mythika for the Mazes & Minotaurs RPG...

Discover the fabled and decadent Kandaria - city of dreams, city of thieves!

This 31-p. supplement contains a detailed gazeteer of the city, plus urban encounter tables and a complete M&M adventure set in Kandaria.

(Previously published in the glorious (and now defunt) Minotaur Quarterly webzine, this material has been specially reformatted for the Atlas of Mythika series of supplements).

boardgame.name: VÃ¡stagos de Shub-Niggurath: Tomo I
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath es una campaña de horror lovecraftiano en seis escenarios que redefine el mito de este primigenio y su influencia sobre la humanidad. Con un arco argumental que desarrolla un plan para destruir a la Cabra Negra, los jugadores se enfrentarán a cuestiones como la identidad, las inteligencias artificiales y la fertilidad, mientras la sombra de los Mitos se proyecta de manera siniestra tras todas ellas. Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath acerca los Mitos al mundo contemporáneo, alejándose de tópicos y adaptando el concepto de horror cósmico a la realidad que nos rodea y a los miedos actuales.

Oscura canción de cuna

El espíritu de Lovecraft se pasea en esta aventura por Maine, la tierra natal de otro maestro del género: Stephen King. La maternidad y la fertilidad sirven de hilo conductor de esta pesadilla que llevará a los personajes jugadores hasta un apacible pueblo ligado al vino y a las uvas, cuya tranquilidad está protegida por un bosque primigenio dispuesto a despedazar a todos aquellos que se adentren en sus secretos. Este escenario es el primero de los seis con que cuenta la campaña Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath, y en él los personajes darán los primeros pasos de una trama enmarañada que no está dispuesta a dejarlos escapar.

Metatheria

En el segundo escenario de la campaña, un nuevo grupo de personajes tendrá que reconstruir los últimos días de una amiga que fue encontrada en la carretera tras haber perdido la memoria. Por el camino, se enfrentarán a descubrimientos sombríos sobre su compañera y sobre ellos mismos. Metatheria introduce a los jugadores de lleno en el arco argumental y les obliga a hacerse preguntas sobre qué está en juego, y qué papel que hay reservado para ellos.

¿CÓMO SE JUEGA?

La campaña Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath utiliza el sistema Cthulhu D100. Cada escenario incluye cuatro personajes pregenerados, aunque no es obligatorio usarlos, y puedes jugar con entre dos y seis personajes jugadores. Todos los escenarios están preparados para poder dirigirse de manera independiente, si así lo prefieres.

boardgame.name: VÃ¡stagos de Shub-Niggurath: Tomo II
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath Tomo II

LA AMBIENTACIÓN

Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath es una campaña de horror lovecraftiano en seis escenarios que redefine el mito de este primigenio y su influencia sobre la humanidad. Con un arco argumental que desarrolla un plan para destruir a la Cabra Negra, los jugadores se enfrentarán a cuestiones como la identidad, las inteligencias artificiales y la fertilidad, mientras la sombra de los Mitos se proyecta de manera siniestra tras todas ellas. Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath acerca los Mitos al mundo contemporáneo, alejándose de tópicos y adaptando el concepto de horror cósmico a la realidad que nos rodea y a los miedos actuales.

EL VUELO DEL CUCO

La construcción del receptáculo que alumbrará al siguiente heredero de Shub-Niggurath ha comenzado. Para engendrar al sucesor de la diosa son imprescindibles los líderes de Los Hijos de Amaltea, los únicos seres vivos que, finalmente, están preparados para canalizar un poder de tal magnitud. Los experimentos fallidos marcan el camino, y una oferta que no se pueden permitir rechazar, hecha por la persona aparentemente equivocada, es lo único que les posibilitará entender su papel en la trama. Quizá no el que habrían deseado.

FRASHOKERETI

En la Siria del s. XIII, un grupo de caballeros de la Orden de San Juan recibe la misión de infiltrarse en el recién rendido Crac de l’Ospital para recuperar un viejo códice escondido en una biblioteca secreta. El libro resulta ser algo más de lo que esperaban, y su descubrimiento pone en marcha una macabra cuenta atrás durante la que los personajes tendrán que mantener un equilibrio inestable entre aliados imposibles, y que acabará convirtiéndoles en testigos, sino protagonistas, del plan milenario de un ignorado grupo de descastados.

¿CÓMO SE JUEGA?

La campaña Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath utiliza el sistema Cthulhu D100. Cada escenario incluye cuatro personajes pregenerados, aunque no es obligatorio usarlos, y puedes jugar con entre dos y seis personajes jugadores. Todos los escenarios están preparados para poder dirigirse de manera independiente, si así lo prefieres.

boardgame.name: VÃ¡stagos de Shub-Niggurath: Tomo III
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath Tomo III

LA AMBIENTACIÓN

Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath es una campaña de horror lovecraftiano en seis escenarios que redefine el mito de este primigenio y su influencia sobre la humanidad. Con un arco argumental que desarrolla un plan para destruir a la Cabra Negra, los jugadores se enfrentarán a cuestiones como la identidad, las inteligencias artificiales y la fertilidad, mientras la sombra de los Mitos se proyecta de manera siniestra tras todas ellas. Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath acerca los Mitos al mundo contemporáneo, alejándose de tópicos y adaptando el concepto de horror cósmico a la realidad que nos rodea y a los miedos actuales.

Escenario 5

TRENDING TOPIC

¿Qué pasaría si el fin de la humanidad fuera anunciado en las redes sociales?

Esta aventura acerca a los personajes a Territorio Lovecraft donde se enfrentarán a algo más terrible que una criatura extraterrestre llena de tentáculos: su propio origen. Esta no es una historia donde el Bien prevalece ante el Mal. Es una historia donde el pasado extiende sus raíces hasta el presente, donde mensajes ocultos señalan el camino a la extinción humana, donde la tecnología juega en contra y donde los personajes jugadores deben elegir qué parte de su humanidad están dispuestos a pagar para evitar el final de su propia especie.
¿Le darías a Like?

Escenario 6

PRINCIPIO

Antes de que todo cambie, los personajes tienen la posibilidad de experimentar de primera mano cómo sería el mundo si el proyecto del sucesor de la diosa tuviera éxito. Este escenario es la culminación de la campaña y bebe de todo lo que ha ocurrido hasta ahora, con referencias a lugares, personas, eventos o artefactos que han ido apareciendo anteriormente. Una vez con todas las piezas delante de ellos, los personajes deben decidir cuál quieren que sea su papel en este plan maestro. Y una vez lo hagan, asegurarse de que todo termina como ellos desearían. Es decir, elegir un nuevo Principio. Para toda la humanidad.

¿CÓMO SE JUEGA?

La campaña Vástagos de Shub-Niggurath utiliza el sistema Cthulhu D100. Cada escenario incluye cuatro personajes pregenerados, aunque no es obligatorio usarlos, y puedes jugar con entre dos y seis personajes jugadores. Todos los escenarios están preparados para poder dirigirse de manera independiente, si así lo prefieres.

boardgame.name: El hombre en el laberinto
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Aún no os lo creéis. Vuestra joven banda de rock se prepara para vivir su mejor experiencia: participar en el macroconcierto Desert Gathering, en el estado de Arizona. Que a la comunidad india del lugar no le parezca buena idea celebrar dos días de rock, juerga y drogas junto a su montaña sagrada, no es algo que os preocupe especialmente. Para vosotros será un sueño hecho realidad… o vuestra peor pesadilla.

boardgame.name: Broken Compass - Quickstart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Broken Compass is an Adventure Role-Playing Game inspired by the great movies and games of the genre, from the Mummy all the way to Uncharted, passing through Indiana Jones and Tomb Raider… and it’s BACK with all new Seasons starring fearsome pirates and daring gentlemen!

In Broken Compass you play as an Adventurer in search of great Treasures, a man or woman of action, ready to risk it all every day, just so they can get to the finish line before their bitter Rival!

boardgame.name: Flashback: Zombie Kidz
boardgame.description:
Lead the investigation in the universe of Zombie Kidz. Your mission: foil the zombies’ nefarious plans!

Flashback is an investigation game using pictures. Embark on a cooperative adventure with other kids or with your whole family in a world frozen in time. Explore the past to solve mysteries in the present, and change the future to save the world!

Discover the whole story, bit by bit, through the eyes of the characters living it. Put together all the points of view to discover clues, uncover and figure out mysteries, and answer the final questions. Understanding the past might help you to change the future and save the world from the horrible monsters!

boardgame.name: Gary's Clarifications
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A compilation of Q&A forum posts accumulated over several years.

From the introduction:

When I saw the Zagyg’s Wisdom super-thread on Dragonsfoot, I thought what a great idea it was to have a section where Gary answered questions about D&D and offered clarifications and interpretations about the game he created. And if he isn’t around to answer more questions, at least we can benefit from what people asked him when they had the chance.

Reading through the thread, it occurred to me that all these clarifications could be gathered up into a single document for easier reference, sorted by category. Steve at Dragonsfoot liked the idea, so I got started...and found that sorting them wasn’t as neat and easy as I’d expected. I’ve had to make a lot of judgement calls: for instance, should a question about true neutral clerics go under Classes or Alignment? So I apologize if the organization of this document seems a little haphazard, but I’ve done what I could with it. There are a very few posts from one category that I copied into another, but for the most part I tried to make a single choice and hope it was the right one.

boardgame.name: Historias de Terror. Tomo II
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

HISTORIAS DE TERROR VOLUMEN II

La recopilación en físico de los shadowshots de terror más descargados del año.

LA HERENCIA
Uno de vosotros recibe una noticia inesperada: el profesor Wilson, un pariente lejano de quien prácticamente no sabe nada, le ha dejado una suculenta herencia. Con una condición: deberá residir en la antigua mansión de su tío. Algo no huele bien en esta historia y el heredero, junto a sus compañeros, no tardarán en descubrirlo.

PESADILLA EN HAUNTED MANOR
El pintor Nathaniel Wingate está en su mejor momento creativo. Sus cuadros, con escenas terroríficas que despiertan admiración y rechazo por igual, se cotizan al alza. El artista vive apartado en su mansión de Green Manor, donde parece encontrar su inspiración. Pero hace semanas que nadie sabe de él y su marchante empieza a estar preocupado, pues a menudo cae en estados depresivos. Una visita le sentará bien, piensa. Cómo acabe esa visita ya es otra cosa.

LA ISLA DE LA PAZ
Un anuncio para participar en una expedición arqueológica en el estado de Guerrero, en México, es toda una tentanción para cualquier amante de la historia… aunque el hecho de que uno de los requisitos sea tener experiencia militar y que esté tan bien pagado debería, como mínimo, levantar ciertas sospechas sobre lo que uno puede encontrarse allí.

NUESTRA ALDEA NUESTRA MUERTE
El invierno está siendo especialmente duro en la aldea de Luach. Y no solo por el frío intenso y la escasez de alimentos. Un mal terrible se ha desatado y ni siquiera la diosa del valle puede protegeros. Pronto no quedará nadie para contarlo. ¿Encontraréis la manera de detenerlo? ¿Llegaréis a tiempo de salvar a vuestros seres queridos? Tic, tac, tic, tac… ¡deprisa, el tiempo se agota!

LA PIEL DE PORCELANA
Un reportaje fotográfico en un parque de atracciones abandonado. Lo que parece una gran idea, pronto se convertirá en una pesadilla. ¿Es el viento o una canción de cuna lo que se oye? ¿Quién a activado el carrusel? Algo acecha entre los hierros oxidados del parque, podéis sentir sus ojos clavados en vuestra espalda… demasiado tarde para echarse atrás.

EL AMULETO DE JADE
Ya lo dice el refrán: quien juega con fuego, se quema los dedos. Y parece que eso es lo que le ha ocurrido a vuestro amigo Carter, cuya desesperada llamada de socorro os arrastrará hasta su infierno particular. En vuestras manos está deshacer sus errores o bien sucumbir al poder de las sombras.

UN RESPLANDOR EN LA NIEBLA
Está anocheciendo y una niebla espesa se expande por doquier… pero, un momento: ¡este no es el camino que habías tomado!. Un pueblo desierto, un extraño resplandor entre la niebla… no auguran nada bueno… y esas inquietantes voces y ruidos que no paran nunca…

LA MALA EDUCACIÓN
Algo ha ocurrido en el Saint George’s, uno de los internados más selectos de Inglaterra. Se impone la discreción: nadie quiere un escándalo, pues, a poco que se rasque la superficie pueden salir a la luz oscuros secretos que arruinen el prestigio de la institución. Sin embargo, esta vez, las cosas han ido demasiado lejos y algo terrible amenaza con traspasar sus centenarios muros.

ELLOS VENDRÁN
La avería del coche no podía ser más inoportuna para la familia Turner, justo en medio del desierto de Arizona. Por suerte, han encontrado una vieja estación de servicio con una gasolinera y un taller mecánico en medio de la nada. Incluso hay un restaurante, ideal para tomar un descanso del largo viaje. Sin embargo, hay algo extraño en este lugar, como si las cosas no fueran lo que parecen ser.

EL HOMBRE EN EL LABERINTO
Aún no os lo creéis. Vuestra joven banda de rock se prepara para vivir su mejor experiencia: participar en el macroconcierto Desert Gathering, en el estado de Arizona. Que la comunidad india del lugar no le parezca buena idea celebrar dos días de rock, juerga y drogas junto a su montaña sagrada, no es algo que os preocupe especialmente. Para vosotros será un sueño hecho realidad… o vuestra peor pesadilla.

EL NIDO VACÍO
Los Ángeles, 1925. La desaparición de una niña de 6 años desencadena una historia detectivesca que acaba con una espiral de terror, locura y muerte.
Basada en una historia real.

boardgame.name: Treasure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Treasure tables suck.

No really, it’s like a video game. I open the chest, what do I find? Wait, wait for it.

Gold. Gems. Magic Items. Every time.

There’s this cool list of items, with an extensive random table that doesn’t take into account the power level of your group or the environment at all. How do I generate an appropriate list of items and treasure for an area without favoring certain PC’s? How can I match the treasure with the approximate danger in the area? How can I randomly generate treasure that doesn’t instantly unbalance my game because of a bad random roll (1% chance of an artifact I’m looking at you).

So I like to run a game that feels, I don’t know, simulationist. And what did historical looters find of value?

Art. Goods. Furnishings.

User summary:

Apparently intended for AD&D, the resource is generic enough to be used in any campaign with "standard values" for gold pieces, etc.

boardgame.name: A Wilderlands Sandbox Campaign
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Additional rules for running a Sword and Sorcery sandbox using the Judges Guild Wilderlands of High Fantasy setting, and the original Basic/Expert rules.

Chapters 1-4 and Appendix A comprise a Player’s Handbook for character creation and reference during play.

Chapters 4 & 5 codify rules and contain tools for the referee to use during play.

boardgame.name: The FlailSnails Jousting Tourney
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Each participant creates a Knight (Fighting Man or Cleric) to enter the lists.

User summary:

An add-on rules system for running jousting tournaments.

boardgame.name: How to Think Faster on Your Feet and GM with More Confidence
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

GMing is part preparation and part performance. And great storytelling and game mastering requires confidence. Study this ebook of over 100 short tips to add at least +1 your mental agility so you can GM with more confidence.

boardgame.name: The Book of Eldritch Gemstones
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

DM: "The chest opens and reveals 200 gold pieces and a chalcedony gem!"
PC: "What's chalcedony look like?"
DM: Note to self - next time place a potion of gaseous form or perhaps a turquoise gem.

User summary:

This document presents color images of various gemstones commonly-encountered in roleplaying games, including name and typical cost in gold pieces.

boardgame.name: Innocent Lights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A geisha grieves for her husband's death and tries to find a way to avenge him. The promise of revenge though takes her a bit too far...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 3
Experience from Completion: ~2,000 XP
General Theme: Ambush, Corruption
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: El nido vacÃ­o
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Los Ángeles, 1925. Un matrimonio destrozado por la desaparición de su hija de 6 años pide ayuda para encontrarla. El caso pronto destapará una realidad que se ha mantenido oculta demasiado tiempo. Niños desaparecidos, una policía ineficaz y poco de fiar, un sospechoso caso sin resolver y un antiguo drama familiar. Todo ello parece conducir inevitablemente a una espiral de terror, locura y muerte.

boardgame.name: Ellos vendrÃ¡n
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

La avería del coche no podía ser más inoportuna para la familia Turner, justo en medio del desierto de Arizona. Por suerte, han encontrado una vieja estación de servicio con una gasolinera y un taller mecánico en medio de la nada. Incluso hay un restaurante, ideal para tomar un descanso del largo viaje.
Sin embargo, hay algo extraño en este lugar, como si las cosas no fueran lo que parecen ser.

boardgame.name: SHOOTHIT Macarra
boardgame.description:
New Card Game.

Transparent and waterproof SHOOTHIT Playing Cards.

compound:

Complete set of 54 cards: 52 playing cards and 2 rule cards.

Game based on 4 different suits of 13 cards.

(Suits: Circle, Triangle, Penta, Square)

HOW PLAY

THE GAME
The game is very simple, if you know how to count you know how to play, you just have to add one.

After dealing all the cards that we cannot seen, each player reveals on his turn a card from his covered deck to his right. Witch he will try to mount to the central deck or mount on the other player or himself, if not, he leave the card on his right.

Creating like this on the right the undercover deck.

Ex: the 5 over the 4 (mounting in an always increasing way)

When a player draws an Ace, he leave the card on the center, creates the center deck and distributes a penalty to all players.Only in the central deck the numbers and ALSO the SUIT hve to be respected.

When the player place a card he have the right to reveal the next one.

ONLY 1 RULE: SHOOTHIT have only a important rule, and it's, you have to try to mount the cards already revealed to your right before revealing another one.

And now you know how play SHOOTHIT!

The rules don't change but only the penalties according to the game mode.

boardgame.name: Last Say
boardgame.description:
This revolutionary educational card game is winning hearts and minds by bringing out our inner wordsmiths! Last Say is a game that uses player creativity to create phrases from drawn cards. You'll have to get clever to make a great sentence. But be careful! Other players can steal your phrase and win the points!

Objective:
Get the ultimate Last Say by winning the most points!

Contents:
180 Cards

How to Play:
Set up:
1. Each player draws 9 cards (3 of connecting words, and 2 each of nouns, verbs, and adjectives). Layout the cards on the table facing up (it does not matter if other players see your cards). After of your turn, replace used cards.

Play:
2. First player forms a sentence with their cards. When using a connecting word you can choose any of the 3 shown on the card.

3.Following players form a new phrase or steal by adding to a previous phrase. They may also replace their unwanted cards.
When it's the next turn of a player who's phrase was stolen, the last player who stole it collects the cards and wins the points. If nobody stole your phrase by your next turn, you win the points. It's a battle to get the

LAST SAY!

How to Win:
4. When one of the decks of cards is finished, count your points to see who won.

Points:

+ 1 Point: Does not include all the colors.

+2 Points: You steal by adding on to a phrase.

+ 3 Points: Includes all the colors.

boardgame.name: Historias de Terror. Tomo I
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

¡Pon a prueba tu cordura con estas catorce aventuras de terror para jugar en una sola sesión! Solo aptas para jugadores con los nervios de acero.
Historias de terror recoge nuestros mejores shadowshots, o aventuras cortas, donde encontrarás terror lovecraftiano, pero también horror realista y hasta ciencia ficción. La mayoría de las historias están diseñadas para Cthulhu d100, y algunas tienen un sistema propio, aunque pueden adaptarse fácilmente a cualquier sistema de juego.

Este libro incluye:
• Seis aventuras al más puro estilo de Ricard Ibáñez: «La desaparición de Linda Warren», «La maldición del pe-ñón del Diablo», «Fin de semana en Bishop House», «Muerte en el expreso», «En el Umbral» y «El cuchillo».
• «Un susurro descarnado» e «Isocianato», de Álvaro Loman.
• «Sesión fatídica», de María del Carmen González Monzo «Mary Gonzo».
• «Mala sangre», escrita por Juan Vera.
• Los tres finalistas del concurso de shadowshots Cthulhu d100 Shadowlands 2020: «Tanbou Djab», de Juan Vera, «Hasta el último hombre», de Ezequiel Barbudo y «Terror en Ebenalp», de Joan Segovia.
• Y la aventura futurista «Ibu», de Francisco Javier Valverde.
boardgame.rpgdesigner: MÂª del Carmen GonzÃ¡lez Monzo Â«Mary GonzoÂ»

boardgame.name: La mala educaciÃ³n
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Algo ha ocurrido en el Saint George's, uno de los internados más selectos de Inglaterra. Se impone la discreción: nadie quiere un escándalo, pues, a poco que se rasque la superficie pueden salir a la luz oscuros secretos que arruinen el prestigio de la institución. Sin embargo, esta vez, las cosas han ido demasiado lejos y algo terrible amenaza con traspasar sus centenarios muros.

boardgame.name: Un resplandor en la niebla
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Está anocheciendo y una niebla espesa se expande por doquier... pero, un momento: ¡este no es el camino que habías tomado!. Un pueblo desierto, un extraño resplandor entre la niebla... no auguran nada bueno... y esas inquietantes voces y ruidos que no paran nunca...

boardgame.name: El Amuleto de Jade
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Ya lo dice el refrán: quien juega con fuego, se quema los dedos. Y parece que eso es lo que le ha ocurrido a vuestro amigo Carter, cuya desesperada llamada de socorro os arrastrará hasta su infierno particular. En vuestras manos está deshacer sus errores o bien sucumbir al poder de las sombras.

boardgame.name: La piel de porcelana
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Un reportaje fotográfico en un parque de atracciones abandonado. Lo que parece una gran idea, pronto se convertirá en una pesadilla. ¿Es el viento o una canción de cuna lo que se oye? ¿Quién a activado el carrusel? Algo acecha entre los hierros oxidados del parque, podéis sentir sus ojos clavados en vuestra espalda... demasiado tarde para echarse atrás.

boardgame.name: La enfermedad
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Beatriz, la bella hija del afamado abogado Carlile Johnson languidece en su lecho. Nadie sabe qué enfermedad la está consumiendo. Su joven madrastra, Laila, está realmente preocupada y acude a gente de su máxima confianza para que la ayuden. ¿Podrán parar a tiempo el mal que está consumiendo a Beatriz? ¿Descubrirán qué se esconde tras los muros de la fastuosa mansión de los Johnson? O, mejor aún, ¿saldrán con vida del intento?

boardgame.name: Nuestra aldea, nuestra muerte
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

El invierno está siendo especialmente duro en la aldea de Luach. Y no solo por el frío intenso y la escasez de alimentos. Un mal terrible se ha desatado y ni siquiera la diosa del valle puede protegeros. Pronto no quedará nadie para contarlo. ¿Encontraréis la manera de detenerlo? ¿Llegaréis a tiempo de salvar a vuestros seres queridos? Tic, tac, tic, tac... ¡deprisa, el tiempo se agota!

boardgame.name: La Isla de la Paz
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Un anuncio para participar en una expedición arqueológica en el estado de Guerrero, en México, es toda una tentanción para cualquier amante de la historia... aunque el hecho de que uno de los requisitos sea tener experiencia militar y que esté tan bien pagado debería, como mínimo, levantar ciertas sospechas sobre lo que uno puede encontrarse allí.

boardgame.name: The Calamity Jar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twice now the Calamity Jar has sent adventurers scrambling, but now it's time for you to get to the bottom of things. Enter the Calamity Jar, plumb the high-tech tower housed within the honeypot, and meet the mastermind behind it all. But be warned: the Darkness comes.

Part 3 of 3 of the Calamity Jar series.

A 4-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 characters. Optimized for APL 8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Aery's Resolve
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A powerless archfey seeks your aid to defeat an invading army of Hags. Will you put an end to a battle that could shake the foundations of the world?

Find out in this dynamic conclusion to the story of WBW-DC-NJ-COU-01: Dear Aery.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

CONTENT WARNING: Possible phobia triggers, arachnophobia, Loss of loved one
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 41)
boardgame.description:
The forty-first issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here!

Letter from the Editor: Alan Bahr
Steffie de Vann brings us The Great Race, a genre-less TinyD6 setting and adventure!
Shawn Carman brings us Tiny Explorers, a Hex-Crawl and Domain Management System for TinyD6!
John Kennedy brings us Tiny Supers: Vice Versa, a Tiny Supers adventure seed about two new heroes in Chicago!
Colin Chapman brings us Beasts Beyond The Stars, a micro-bestiary for TinyD6 of cosmic entities!

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 42)
boardgame.description:
The forty-second issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here!

Letter from the Editor: Alan Bahr
Steffie de Vaan's Dungeon Defenders
Colin Chapmans Beasts Beyond...the Villains Lair
Joe McGee's Tiny Gods of the Arena, a gladiator themed three-part series.
John Kennedy's Tiny Vistas

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 43)
boardgame.description:
The forth-[third] issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here!

Letter from the Editor: Alan Bahr
Steffie de Vann brings us Heritages Reclaimed for Tiny Dungeon 2e
Lucus Palosaari brings us Big Pharma for Tiny Wastelands
Richard August brings us Barrowmere, a Tiny Cthulhu microsetting
Joe McGee brings us the second part of Tiny Gods of the Arena.

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 44)
boardgame.description:
The forth-[fourth] issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here!

Letter from the Editor: Alan Bahr
Steffie de Vann brings us The Krampus Heist, a TinyD6 adventure!
Jack Norris brings us Altogether Now!, an article about Team Traits for Tiny Supers.
Joe McGee concludes his Tiny Gods of the Arena series.
Shawn Carman brings us The USS Tennessee for Tiny Wastelands
Christopher Helton brings us The Original Chthonic Gods for Tiny Cthulhu.

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 45)
boardgame.description:
The first TinyZine of 2022 is here!

Featuring articles and adventures for TinyD6 games like Tiny Dungeon 2e, Tiny Cthulhu and more!

boardgame.name: Pesadilla en Haunted Manor
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

El pintor Nathaniel Wingate está en su mejor momento creativo. Sus cuadros, con escenas terroríficas que despiertan admiración y rechazo por igual, se cotizan al alza. El artista vive apartado en su mansión de Green Manor, donde parece encontrar su inspiración. Pero hace semanas que nadie sabe de él y su marchante empieza a estar preocupado, pues a menudo cae en estados depresivos. Una visita le sentará bien, piensa. Cómo acabe esa visita ya es otra cosa.

boardgame.name: The Hag's Hut
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:
